signUp.header1: This learning platform is for educational purposes and is intended for healthcare professionals only.
signUp.header2: By registering to this platform, you confirm that you are a healthcare professional and that all information provided in your registration is true and correct.
signUp.optin: I agree to receive email notifications related to the content of this program
account.header: Critical Dose Drug Considerations for Post-Transplant Patients
account.pp1: Medication errors are frequent both in the hospital and outpatient setting. They are the third leading cause of outpatient visits and responsible for 5- 41% of hospital admissions. Polypharmacy is common in post-transplant patients and can increase the risk of medication related problems resulting in higher risk of morbidity and mortality. This program will educate pharmacists on the key role they have in mitigating medication errors and focus on common drug-specific, patient-specific, and clinician-specific factors that may lead to medication errors.
account.pp2l1: Upon completion of the program, participants will be able to:
account.pp2l2: Recognize the volume of medications and complexity of medication regimens taken by transplant recipients
account.pp2l3: Explain the drug-specific, patient-specific, and clinician-specific factors which increase the risk of medication errors in transplant patients
account.pp2l4: Discuss and incorporate practice tips presented to minimize the risk of medication errors in transplant patients
account.pp3:
The Canadian Council on Continuing Education in Pharmacy has accredited this program for 1.00 CEUs.
CCCEP # 1480-2023- 3732-I-P.
(Accreditation period: January 15, 2024 – January 15, 2025)

privacy:
This website is owned by Astellas Pharma Canada, Inc. and operated by the International Centre for Professional Development in Health and Medicine (ICPDHM).

Astellas is aware of your concern for privacy when using www.NTICHE.com (the “Site”). We want to give you the opportunity to know what information we collect about you and what rights you have in relation to such information. At all times, however, Astellas reserves the right, and you consent to such right, to disclose information where required by law or to comply with valid legal process (such as a search warrant, subpoena or court order), to protect the company’s rights or property, including without limitation the right to transfer the data in the event of a transfer of control of Astellas or the sale of substantially all of its assets, or during emergencies when safety is at risk.

At this Site you have control over how your Personal Information (as defined below) is obtained, used and given out. Your Personal Information is kept in strict confidence; Astellas utilizes appropriate security safeguards to keep your information confidential and secure. Only authorized personnel have access to your Personal Information and we do not release your Personal Information to third parties other than those third parties that are necessary to satisfy the Purposes (as defined below) for which the Personal Information was collected, including third party service providers. While we cannot guarantee that errors, loss or unauthorized access to your Personal Information will not occur, our procedures and systems are designed to protect your Personal Information from such events.

Please be sure to read this entire Internet Privacy Statement before using or submitting information to this Site. By using this Site, you agree with the terms of this Internet Privacy Statement. Whenever you submit information via this Site, you consent to the collection, use and disclosure of that information in accordance with this Internet Privacy Statement. Your use of this Site is also subject to the Terms of Use for the www.NTICHE.com website.

INFORMATION WE COLLECT AND HOW WE USE IT

Personally Identifiable Information.

Personally identifiable information includes, but is not limited to, your name, email, pharmacist license number or any other information which might reasonably be used to identify you individually (collectively “Personal Information”). Astellas collects Personal Information from you only when it is voluntarily provided. We collect your Personal Information for the following purposes:

  • to identify you;
  • protect us both against error and fraud;
  • to identify preferences and interests of Site users and
  • comply with legal requirements,
  • collectively, the "Purposes."
Except as set out above, Personal Information will not be sold, rented or exchanged with unaffiliated entities unless you are first notified and expressly consent to such transfer.

ICPDHM does not set “cookies” for this Site or collect any information via the use of bits of information deposited in the visitor’s computer.

Non-Personally Identifiable Information.

The ICPDHM web server captures the Internet Protocol (IP) addresses of each connection to this Site and the specific web pages visited during that connection. An IP address is a number assigned to your computer by your Internet Service Provider so you can access the Internet and is generally considered to be non-personally identifiable information because in most cases it changes each time you connect to the Internet. IP addresses may be used to diagnose problems with our server, report aggregate information, determine the fastest route for your computer to use in connecting to the site, and administer and improve the site. Although the IP address and related information collected is stored in the server log files, no individual is authorized to access those files for any purpose other than system maintenance. We may also use this information to help improve our website and our services by better understanding our audience. ICPDHM may also collect non- personally identifiable information in aggregate form to track data such as the total number of visits to our websites, the number of visitors to each page of our websites, and the domain names of our visitors’ Internet service providers. We may use this information, which remains in aggregate form, to understand how our visitors use our websites so that we may make the sites better.

Children.

Astellas does not knowingly collect any Personal Information from children under 18 years old through this Site. However, if the parent or guardian of a child under 18 believes that the child has provided us with Personal Information, the parent or guardian of that child should contact us at APCA_Privacy.Commission@Astellas.com if they want this information deleted from our files. Anyone under 18 years old should seek their parent’s or guardian’s permission prior to using or disclosing any Personal Information on this Site.

Data Integrity and Security.

Astellas takes reasonable steps to protect your personally identifiable information as you transmit your information from your computer to our site and to protect your information from loss, misuse and unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration or destruction. All information transmitted to this Site is secure to the extent possible using existing technology. You should keep in mind, however, that no Internet transmission is ever 100% secure or error-free. In particular, email sent to or from this Site may not be secure, and you should therefore take special care in deciding what information you send to us via email. Moreover, where you use passwords, ID numbers, or other special access features on this Site, it is your responsibility to safeguard them.

YOUR RIGHTS

Consent. We need to get your consent before obtaining or using Personal Information, or disclosing such Personal Information to anyone. By using this Site and providing your Personal Information, you are consenting to our use of your Personal Information for the Purposes. You can withdraw this consent whenever you want, unless legal requirements prevent this. Let us know if you do not want us to use your Personal Information in any particular way, including uses described in this Privacy Statement by contacting Astellas’ Privacy Commissioner at APCA_Privacy.Commission@Astellas.com.

Review, Corrections and Deletions. At any time, upon reasonable notice, you can review all your Personal Information held by Astellas and request corrections to it or that it be destroyed. Subject to legal requirements, we will comply with your request as soon as we are able to do so. We rely on you to provide us with your complete, accurate and current information.

Questions. All questions or concerns regarding our use of your Personal Information and this Privacy Statement should be directed to Astellas Privacy Commissioner.

GENERAL

Links to Other Websites. Please note that the Site contains links to other third party sites and Astellas cannot represent or guarantee that these sites have privacy policies similar to Astellas. This Privacy Statement does not cover third party practices and Astellas disclaims all liability in relation to such third parties.
